title: Web server error by Cloudflare for secure sites
content:
Desktop Mac with Sonoma OS, up-to-date. Not signed into Mozilla. VPN is off. Extensions off. History, Cache and Cookies deleted. Restarted computer. Returned from a 10-day vacation and now I can't access secure banking websites on Firefox 130.0.1 but Chrome works without issue. I don't access banks that often so I can't say with assurance that the problem occurred over the last 10 days.

I use the Firefox Settings, Saved passwords page and click on the website address for the specific site there to ensure the username and password will load. Twice today, different banking institutions, I was unable to login. Continue to receive an error message. One was for Secure Connection Failed ... unable to verify data received from site. Second (different) site was for Web Server Error involving Cloudfare despite my Firefox settings set to use DNS Quad9, not Cloudflare. Currently set to Maximum Protection-Custom-Quad9 which has always functioned before. Have tried to use "Default Protection"and "Increased Protection" with no change in outcome.

If I have to copy and paste my username and password from Firefox to a Chrome site each time, there's no point in continuing to use Firefox.

title: Stylized text not appearing correctly on webpages
content:
I'm currently trying to diagnose an issue with my Firefox. Ever since I upgraded to macOS Sequoia on my MacBook Pro, certain stylized/formatted texts in Firefox have not been showing up correctly in the browser. I've attached an example below from YouTube. The part of the stylized title text that says "Playlist" is messed up on the YouTube page, but it's correctly rendered in the tab bar. Pasting the YouTube video title into the search bar renders the text correctly in the search bar, but not in the actual search window or results page. I'm also seeing this issue on Instagram, Twitter, etc., so it isn't just a problem with YouTube/Google. The text renders correctly in Chrome and Safari, so I don't think it's necessarily a problem with my computer.

Here's what I've tried so far to diagnose/fix the issue:

  • Quitting Firefox and restarting my computer: didn't work
  • Opening Firefox in Troubleshoot Mode: the text remains messed up
  • Deleting prefs.js from my profile folder: my Firefox stops working and no pages load, not even the New Tab page
  • Firefox Refresh: also did not work
  • Creating a fresh Firefox profile: the new profile renders the text correctly, but signing into my Firefox account on the profile causes the issue to come up again
  • Uninstalling Firefox completely, reinstalling: the text renders, but once again signing into my account causes the issue to reemerge
  • Opening Firefox on my old computer (also MacBook Pro) while signed into my Firefox account: for some reason, the stylized text renders correctly on this computer

I'm at a dead end right now, and would appreciate any help. I could always just create a new profile and forget about it, but this has been driving me crazy for the past few hours. I really don't want to configure all my extensions and browser settings from the beginning, and I hope that I can keep using my original account.

Anyone have any idea what could be going wrong? Thank you!
creator: tobyma100

title: Top SOP Writing Services to Make Your Application Stand Out
content: Crafting a standout Statement of Purpose (SOP) is essential for academic success, and the expertise of the best SOP writers can make a significant difference. These professionals excel in creating personalized, compelling statements that reflect your unique academic journey and aspirations. Expert SOP writers are adept at tailoring your SOP to meet the specific requirements of various programs. Their deep understanding of admissions processes helps highlight your strengths and align your narrative with what committees are seeking. Choosing the best SOP writing services ensures your statement is well-structured, grammatically correct, and impactful. Key attributes of top SOP writers include their ability to personalize content, their detailed knowledge of different fields, and their professional approach. By hiring professional SOP writers, you save time, enhance your application, and increase your chances of acceptance. To find the right SOP writer, look for those with positive reviews, relevant experience, and effective communication skills. Investing in a skilled SOP writer can significantly boost your application and help you stand out in a competitive field. https://www.bestsopwriters.net/

title: Option "Open with" is grayed out on the download dialog
content:
Hello,

After a few days I noticed that the option "open with" on the downloads dialog is always grayed out (see the attached picture).

If I go on the settings and tell the browser to not ask and open directly the file, it opens without any problem... (actually it shows an advertisement saying it is an executable file, but when I dismiss it, it opens)

Here are my system setup: Nom: Firefox Version: 130.0.1 Identifiant de compilation: 20240913135723 ID de distribution: mozilla-deb Canal de mise à jour: release Agent utilisateur: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:130.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/130.0 Système d’exploitation: Linux 6.1.0-25-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.106-3 (2024-08-26) Thème du système d’exploitation: Breeze / Adwaita Binaire de l’application: /usr/lib/firefox/firefox-bin

Does anybody else is having this issue? Any ideas on how can I fix it?

Thanks in advance for all your help,

Best regards, Marc

EDIT: I just tested the behavior on the "base" Firefox-ESR, and it works as expected, as you can see on the 2nd attached file, esr.png... Version: 28.2.0esr Identifiant de compilation: 20240826114743 ID de distribution: mozilla-deb Canal de mise à jour: esr

title: Bookmark-Bar not shown in fullscreen mode with newer firefox version
content:
Hi all I like to show the bookmark toolbar in fullscreen mode. I have enabled "show always" but it does not show in fullscreen mode. On old firefox versions i could create a userChrome.css file and then it worked. But it looks like this is not possible with never (130.0.1 ATM) versions. May be the code has changed? This was my "old" css code wich is still working with firefox-esr: /* 

  Override hiding of Bookmarks Toolbar in F11 full screen   when you roll down the tabs/main toolbar
  • /
  1. navigator-toolbox[inFullscreen="true"] #PersonalToolbar { 
 visibility: unset !important;

}

Hint: toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets is set to true.

Maybe someone has a solution how to show bookmars in fullscreen.
